q: had tried to break open a golden sarcophagus, hoping to find treasures inside, and some skeletons were also damaged, Zahi Hawass said. A gallery displaying King Tut's treasures, on the other hand, was fully secure and had not been damaged . After the break-in, troops were deployed around the landmark rose stone building formally known as the Egyptian Museum of Antiquities, which has about 120 000 items on display or in storage. down the pipeline," the minister said. Labour claimed the decision to appoint Andy Coulson to such a senior Downing Street post raised questions about David Cameron 's judgment. Ed Miliband , the Labour leader, said: The cloud of allegations surrounding Andy Coulson 's tenure at the News of the World raised real questions about his ability to be at the heart of the Downing Street machine. He's now done the right thing but he should have done it earlier. I think it raises real questions about David Cameron 's judgment that he hung on to Andy Coulson for so long. Downing Street sources dismissed Labour's criticism and insisted the prime minister believed that Andy Coulson 's professionalism in sharpening up the Tories' media operation after his appointment in 2007 vindicated David Cameron 's original decision. The former American Idol judge was asked during a news conference whether viewers would see the "old Simon Cowell " or a different side to him when the show premieres on Fox later this year. Look, you adapt over the years, he replied. "I started to cringe when I started to see people being booked as the so-called mean judge and just being gratuitously rude for the sake of it. I don't like that.
